clues.text: At 472 stations, this city boasts the world's largest rapid transit system.
The Shanghai Transrapid is the world's fastest commercial train. It runs on this type of gravity-defying technology.
An articulated vehicle can do this when turning at sharp corners.
This city boasts the only shared bus and light rail subway in the US, in which hybrid buses switch to electricity after entering the portal.

The salty ocean air poses aa risk of ice buildup on the third rail of this Boston rail line, so it switches to overhead catenary power with a retractable pantograph after trains leave the East Boston Tunnel.
Common knowledge proclaims that this former US president was inspired by the German Autobahn to create the Interstate Highway System.
A sign with a pilgrim's hat welcomes you onto this tolled Interstate in the Northeast.
clues.answer: Massachusetts Turnpike (or I-90 or Mass Pike)

clues.text: At barely over two miles long, this Interstate in Castro Valley, California does not fit the usual rules of numbering three-digit highways.
This type of auxiliary Interstate has no termini. Colloquially, politics also happen inside it.
This US state hopes a Mile 419.99 marker on Interstate 70 will thwart roadtripping stoners.
Black Rock City is six miles east of Gerlach, Nevada, home of this perrenial event based on radical self-sufficiency.
Valentine, Texas, about 25 miles from the US-Mexico border, is home to the world's most remote manifestation of this luxury clothing brand.
Name the only state in the US with enclaved time zones. It's home to the Navajo & Hopi Nations.
Surrounded by ridges on two sides, Salt Lake City's geography causes this type of phenomenon that leaves the mountains warmer than the valley.
Breaking brand guidelines, McDonalds allowed its location in this Southwestern city to recolor its Golden Arches into turquoise. It's also home to the Georgia O'Keefe Museum.

Established in 1920, the world's second oldest airline currently operates the third longest non-stop flight——from Perth to London.
Callsign DYNASTY! This airline is the flag carrier of a disputed Asian island country and is the tenth largest airline by freight.
To tilt a plane in flight, you would adjust these surfaces on the wings of the aircraft, otherwise known as 'little wing' or 'fin' in French.

In 1983, Air Canada Flight 143 ran out of fuel mid-flight due to a unit conversion error on the ground, but it landed safely with no engine functions by Captain Bob Pearson. The 767 went on to fly for another 25 years and was affectionately named the "G"imli this.

On New Year's Eve 1984, the drummer of this band lost his arm in a near fatal car accident.
The best-selling computer model of all time was introduced in 1982 and went on to sell more than 17 million units by 1994.
This former GM executive was arrested in 1982 for attempting to sell cocaine to save this struggling car brand.
The Soviet Union, Japan, and the European Space Agency rushed to send an "armada" of probes to intercept this comet in 1986.
This Prince song inspired Tipper Gore to introduce the Parental Advisory sticker after she witnessed her daughter listening to it.
This modern regime that lasted 4 years changed the national motto to "Travail, Famille, Patrie"——"Work, Family, Fatherland".
